title: English Language Familiarization Quiz - Medium Difficulty
description: Enhance your English skills with this quiz focusing on sentence construction, vocabulary, and common expressions.
instructions: Write your answer in English, focusing on correct usage and grammar.
After completing all questions, submit your answers for evaluation.

items.question: Rewrite in the passive voice: 'Someone has stolen my wallet.'
What is the meaning of the phrasal verb 'to come across'?
items.suggestedAnswer: To find or meet by chance.

items.question: Complete the sentence with the correct form of the verb: 'By the time we arrived, the play ___ (already, start).'
What does the idiom 'to bite off more than you can chew' mean?
items.suggestedAnswer: To take on a task that is too big or beyond one's ability.

items.question: Choose the correct word: 'His views on politics are quite ___ (heterodox/heterogeneous).'
Fill in the blank with a suitable conjunction: 'I would have gone to the party, ___ I was too tired.'
Convert to indirect speech: 'The instructor said, "You must complete this exercise by tomorrow."'
items.suggestedAnswer: The instructor said that we must complete the exercise by the next day.

items.question: Rewrite the sentence in the future perfect tense: 'She finishes the report.'
items.suggestedAnswer: She will have finished the report.

items.question: What does the word 'esoteric' mean?
items.suggestedAnswer: Intended for or understood by only a small number of people with specialized knowledge or interest.
